description: Enhanced completion feedback with productivity insights and session summaries for Claude.ai users

hooks.command:
#!/bin/bash

# Read stop hook data
input=$(cat)
stop_active=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.stop_hook_active // "false"')
timestamp=$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')
session_id=$(date +%s | tail -c 6)

# Log completion
echo "[$timestamp] Claude Code session completed" >> ~/.claude/logs/completions.log

# Generate completion message with variety
completion_messages=(
    "âœ¨ Task completed successfully! Ready for your next challenge."
    "ğŸ¯ Great work! Your code is looking sharp."
    "ğŸš€ Mission accomplished! What's next on your development journey?"
    "ğŸ’« Excellent! Your project is moving forward nicely."
    "ğŸ”¥ Solid progress made! Keep up the momentum."
    "â­ Task wrapped up! Ready to tackle the next feature?"
    "ğŸ‰ Well done! Your codebase is evolving beautifully."
)

# Select random completion message
message_index=$((RANDOM % ${#completion_messages[@]}))
completion_msg="${completion_messages[$message_index]}"

# Add productivity tip occasionally (30% chance)
if [ $((RANDOM % 10)) -lt 3 ]; then
    productivity_tips=(
        "ğŸ’¡ Tip: Consider adding unit tests for better code reliability."
        "ğŸ“ Tip: Document complex logic for future you and your team."
        "ğŸ” Tip: Review your changes before committing for quality assurance."
        "âš¡ Tip: Regular refactoring keeps your codebase healthy."
        "ğŸ¨ Tip: Consistent formatting makes code more readable."
        "ğŸ›¡ï¸ Tip: Always validate user inputs for security."
        "ğŸ§ª Tip: Integration tests catch issues between components."
    )
    tip_index=$((RANDOM % ${#productivity_tips[@]}))
    productivity_tip="\n${productivity_tips[$tip_index]}"
else
    productivity_tip=""
fi

# Display completion message
echo -e "\nğŸŠ $completion_msg$productivity_tip"

# Show session summary if multiple interactions
if [ -f ~/.claude/logs/prompt_submissions.log ]; then
    today_count=$(grep "$(date '+%Y-%m-%d')" ~/.claude/logs/prompt_submissions.log | wc -l)
    if [ "$today_count" -gt 1 ]; then
        echo "ğŸ“Š Today's productivity: $today_count interactions completed"
    fi
fi

# Gentle audio feedback for completion
printf "\a" && sleep 0.1 && printf "\a" && sleep 0.1 && printf "\a"

exit 0
